justification: “Math skills were measured with number line estimation tasks for fractions, whole number frequencies, and percentages… Participants’ performance … was measured as percent absolute error (Siegler & Booth, 2004).”
“Need for Cognition. This scale consists of the average of six items assessing the extent to which people enjoy engaging in the process of thinking (Cacioppo & Petty, 1982…).”
“The health literacy measure (Chew et al., 2008) included three items … confidence in filling out medical forms … help read health materials … difficulty understanding written materials.”

measured_by: 6-item Risk Perception scale (absolute cognitive, comparative, experiential items for self and others)
justification: “Risk perceptions … were assessed as the perceived likelihood that oneself and close others would be infected with COVID-19 in the next year. “COVID-19 Worry … was assessed as the extent of worry that oneself and close others would be infected with COVID-19… all four items were averaged to form one scale.”
